Description: Stamp-seal in glazed steatite (?); rectangular plaque with a pierced handle at the back; underside roughly and deeply engraved design in square frame; motif representing a Tanit sign; traces of green glaze; one edge chipped.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

A variant of the Tanit sign appears on another object found at Naukratis, a model of a horned altar: British Museum 1909,1201.5. Tanit signs appear regularly on seals and seal impressions in the first millennium BC.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (PA.14)
